main event: The report contains detailed eyewitness accounts of a UFO sighting in Washington D.C. on May 15, 1952.
interesting points: The UFO was described as goldish-orange in color and had a circular or oval shape, appearing disc-like or amorphous in structure.
One of the observers reported the UFO coming to an abrupt stop and vanishing without making any sound.
Multiple observers, including US Navy ensigns and a civilian employee, described the UFO as moving slowly at low altitude and then disappearing at a fast speed.
The UFO was observed for a duration ranging from 6 to 10 seconds, and it covered a wide arc in the sky before vanishing.
The witnesses emphasized that the object was not mistaken for searchlight reflection, a meteor, or any conventional aircraft or balloon.
